regions.name: Lima
regions.description: Peru's capital with significant urban water infrastructure, though rural areas surrounding Lima face challenges.
regions.challenges: Urban sprawl, aging infrastructure, seasonal water shortages

regions.name: Cusco
regions.description: Mountain region with historical significance. Water access varies greatly between urban centers and remote communities.
regions.challenges: High altitude, limited infrastructure, indigenous communities underserved

regions.name: Ayacucho
regions.description: Rural region with significant water scarcity. Many communities rely on seasonal rainfall and groundwater.
regions.challenges: Extreme water scarcity, poverty, limited government resources

regions.name: Puno
regions.description: High-altitude region near Lake Titicaca. Despite proximity to water, distribution infrastructure is inadequate.
regions.challenges: Altitude, cold climate, infrastructure maintenance in harsh conditions

regions.name: Junín
regions.description: Central highlands region with significant indigenous population. Water quality and access remain major concerns.
regions.challenges: Mining activities, water contamination, rural isolation

regions.name: Apurímac
regions.description: One of Peru's poorest regions with critical water shortage issues affecting subsistence farming communities.
regions.challenges: Extreme poverty, drought, lack of infrastructure

regions.name: Huancavelica
regions.description: Remote mountain region where many villages have no access to piped water systems.
regions.challenges: Geographic isolation, high poverty, limited road access

regions.name: Ucayali
regions.description: Amazon region with paradoxical situation of abundant water but poor quality and contamination issues.
regions.challenges: Water contamination, limited treatment facilities, riverine communities

regions.name: Loreto
regions.description: Peru's largest region by area in the Amazon. Indigenous communities face water quality challenges.
regions.challenges: Remote locations, limited infrastructure, rainforest environment

regions.name: Amazonas
regions.description: Northern Amazon region where water scarcity paradoxically affects highland and valley communities.
regions.challenges: Geographic isolation, limited government reach, indigenous rights

regions.name: Arequipa
regions.description: Southern coastal and highland region with better urban infrastructure but rural challenges persist.
regions.challenges: Coastal desert, mining competition for water, rural-urban divide

regions.name: Tacna
regions.description: Southernmost region with desert climate. Urban centers have adequate water but rural areas suffer severe scarcity.
regions.challenges: Desert climate, agricultural water demands, border region issues

regions.name: Moquegua
regions.description: Small southern region between Arequipa and Tacna. Water is critically limited due to desert environment.
regions.challenges: Desert conditions, small tax base, agricultural needs

regions.name: Ica
regions.description: Coastal region where agricultural demands compete with urban water needs. Aquifer depletion is a major concern.
regions.challenges: Over-extraction of groundwater, agricultural irrigation, aquifer depletion

regions.name: Ancash
regions.description: Central coast and highlands region. Mountain communities face water scarcity while coastal areas have infrastructure issues.
regions.challenges: Glacial melt impacts, aging infrastructure, industrial pollution
